quotes.quote: Beauty isn't worth thinking about. What's important is your mind. You don't want a fifty dollar haircut on a fifty cent head.
A hair in the head is worth two in the brush.
Hair brings one’s self image into focus. It is vanity’s proving ground.  Hair is terribly personal, a tangle of mysterious prejudices.
When red headed people are above a certain social grade their hair is auburn.
You don't ever ask a barber whether you need a haircut.
You're only as good as your last haircut.
God is like a barber: don't expect him to give you a haircut, you must first get at his barbershop.
One of the most important things about looking youthful is to have a modern haircut.
What we offer is good enough. It's like my haircut: It ain't pretty, but it's good enough.
To this day, my haircut is the number two clippers, which I apply to myself every month.
Hair style is the final tip-off whether or not a woman really knows herself.
The worse the haircut, the better the man.
With short hair you have to get a haircut every two or three weeks. And if you're coloring your hair, you have to color it that often. Every time I did it, I felt fraudulent.
Some of the worst mistakes in my life were haircuts.
A woman who cuts her hair is about to change her life.
My hair had grown out long and shaggy not in that sexy young rock star kind of way but in that time to take rover to the groomer kind of way.
